Virat Kohli and KL Rahul guided India to a comfortable six-wicket victory over Australia in their Cricket World Cup opener.
KL Rahul scored an unbeaten 97 off 115 balls and was named Player of the Match.
India won by 6 wickets with 52 balls remaining.
Virat Kohli and K.L. Rahul's 165-run partnership for the fourth wicket rescued India from a precarious three wickets for two runs.
India's pursuit of a modest target began with a historically bad start at 2/3.
Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood left India reeling with three wickets in the first two overs.
India found themselves at 3-2 after the early onslaught.
KL Rahul finished the game with a six, ending on 97 not out.
Ravindra Jadeja took 3 wickets for 28 runs.
Virat Kohli was dropped on 12 by Mitch Marsh, which proved costly as Kohli reached 85 before being caught at mid-wicket.
Ravindra Jadeja was the pick of the spinners with 3-28.
Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood combined to send Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kashan, and Shreyas Iyer back to the pavilion for ducks.
Pat Cummins rued the drop of Virat Kohli early in the chase.
KL Rahul and Virat Kohli created a match-winning partnership under high pressure.
Rohit Sharma also joined an unwanted list as he became the third India captain to get out for 0 in a World Cup match.
Australia's platform of 2-110 quickly eroded to 5-119 due to Jadeja's three wickets in 2.3 overs.
Ravindra Jadeja shone with the ball, picking up 3 wickets as India bowled Australia out for 199.
Kuldeep Yadav took the crucial wicket of David Warner for 41.
Australia went 73 balls between boundaries and hit two in total between the 16th and 39th overs.
Josh Hazlewood and Mitchell Starc ran through the Indian top-order on Sunday.
Ishan Kishan's early dismissal after attempting an extravagant drive against Mitchell Starc.
KL Rahul finished unbeaten on 97, and he and Kohli put on 165 for the fourth wicket.
Virat Kohli scored 85 off 116 balls.
Rohit Sharma was out for 0 after facing 6 balls in Chennai.
Ishan Kishan was out for a golden duck in his World Cup debut.
Kuldeep Yadav and Jasprit Bumrah picked up 2 wickets each while R Ashwin and Mohammed Siraj chipped in with a wicket each.
India won by six wickets, posting 201 for four in 41.2 overs.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 35 runs.
Josh Hazlewood took 3 wickets for 38 runs.
Kuldeep Yadav took 2 wickets for 42 runs.
Mitchell Starc took 1 wicket for 31 runs.

Rohit Sharma, Ishan Kishan and Shreyas Iyer did not trouble the scorers at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.
